definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: There's more money going out than coming in, I'm worried about the business.
sentences.chinese: 資金入不敷出，我很爲生意犯愁。

sentences.english: You shouldn't worry about the present either. There is no river that can't be crossed.
sentences.chinese: 你對目前的申請別犯愁，沒有過不去的河嘛。

sentences.english: Urban planners may fret about traffic and pollution.
sentences.chinese: 城市規劃者可能會爲擁護的交通和環境的污染而犯愁。

sentences.english: The English test of tomorrow really worrys me.
sentences.chinese: 明天的英語考試讓我犯愁。

sentences.english: I don't thellonk you need worry.

definition: to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
erhua variant of 納悶|纳闷[na4 men4]
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
